article: Dear Dad, I was very upset when I received your letter. I knew you _ not like my results, but I didn't realize you and Mum were so _ with me. This has made me _ very carefully about myself, and now I _ how silly I have been. My poor _ have come from my own _ . Of course, I want to do my best. I want you and Mum to be proud _ me, but somehow when I get to school I just can't keep my _ on the subject and I stop listening to the teacher. So many other things seem so much more _ , but I know that I must not _ the chance you and Mum have given me. If I don't work very hard 5 _ he next few months, I am going to get _ results. So I am going to study hard this summer. And I will show Mum anything _ I can't understand so that she can give me help. I _ you will allow me to play some basketball. I think I need some exercise, _ I will control the time I _ on it properly. If you want me to stop meeting Cindy, I will -- but there is _ serious. We are just good friends, and she often helps me _ my schoolwork. Dad, I am really sorry I have made you angry. I'm going to try my best to _ my study. I promise that I will make you proud of me soon. Yours, Jimmy
